comments.content:
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/sql/copy-into-table
FORCE = TRUE | FALSE
Definition
Boolean that specifies to load all files, regardless of whether they’ve been loaded previously and have not changed since they were loaded. Note that this option reloads files, potentially duplicating data in a table.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/snowsql-config
If enabled, SnowSQL forces the PUT command to upload (i.e. stage) data files from a local directory/folder on a client machine to the specified internal (i.e. Snowflake) stage without checking whether the files already exist in the stage. If the files are already present in the destination stage, the PUT command overwrites the existing files.

CORRECT is B
FORCE parameter avoid snowflake duplicate files check in historic of files loaded.

discussion.content:
76. Snow sight supports the following types of charts:
• Bar charts
• Line charts
• Scatterplots
• Heat grids
• Scorecards

Selected Answer: CE
C & E are correct

Visualizing worksheet data
This topic describes how to visualize your SQL worksheet results using charts in Snowsight. Charts transform your query results into visualizations that communicate logical relationships and lead to more informed decision making. Charts let you quickly identify and understand patterns and outliers in data.

Snowsight supports the following types of charts:

Bar charts

Line charts

Scatterplots

Heat grids

Scorecards

You can also visualize your data using dashboards.

Selected Answer: CE
correct
CE are correct
C and E are correct

Selected Answer: E
Correct

questions.question_text: Which type of charts are supported by Snowsight? (Choose two.)

A user wants to upload a file to an internal Snowflake stage using a PUT command.

Which tools and/or connectors could be used to execute this command? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/developer-guide/sql-api/intro#label-sql-api-limitations:
The following commands are not supported:

The PUT command (in Snowflake SQL)

The GET command (in Snowflake SQL)
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/sql/put:
The command cannot be executed from the Worksheets Worksheet tab page in either Snowflake web interface; instead, use the SnowSQL client or Drivers to upload data files, or check the documentation for a specific Snowflake client to verify support for this command.

Selected Answer: BD
Limitations of the SQL API

The SQL API has the following limitations:

The following commands are not supported:
The PUT command (in Snowflake SQL)
The GET command (in Snowflake SQL)

Selected Answer: BC
The SQL API is a programmatic interface for connecting to Snowflake. It is the most powerful way to execute SQL commands in Snowflake.(The Python connector is a library that allows you to connect to Snowflake from Python. It can be used to execute SQL commands, but it is not as well-supported as SnowSQL or the SQL API.)

Therefore, the two tools that can be used to execute the command are SnowSQL and the SQL API.
BD is correct

Selected Answer: BD
Correct
